text: <@U04BD6KB1>: I’d look at the ember cli version and skim for issues revolving around that
I once came across the same thing and updating fixed it
older versions definitely had a bug but it was fixed ages ago; i’m using the latest beta. have you run into this in the past few months?
haven’t generated an addon in the last few months sadly :disappointed:
ok, well thanks for the pointer
you’re welcome :smile:
i’ll have a look
<@U04BD6KB1>: Which addon are you using the blueprint for? Is it using an old version of ember-cli?
latest ember-cli, the blueprint is for a soon-to-be-released `ember-cli-horizon` addon
it’s the beta cli but they’ve been stable recently
Ah, ok...So it's your addon?
yup, i’ve got a 100 like it that work fine. not sure why this one is acting up.
hrm...weird
and by 100 i mean about a dozen :smile:
(i’m a fan of exaggeration)
Keeps things exciting :wink:
indeed

Architecture question:
Reusable routes
Create object
Edit object
Let's say we're in the library and select an object to edit it. We navigate to the edit route
At the end of the edit route we go back to the library route
But in the create new journey we go to the choose which type to create route, then create a new record and navigate to the edit object route
At the end of edit object we want to return to a different route. Not the library but the "fix up references to this new object" route
So you can picture this as a series of micro user journeys which can be connected together as a flow chart
How would you go about telling child route where to navigate next on completion?
This would become a stack of instructions if you nested these micro journeys
Thoughts?
a state machine?
injected as a service
Where would you put the state?
Interesting
Have you seen this existing anywhere?
Feels like it's a pretty common requirement
<https://github.com/nathanhammond/ember-flows>

attachments.title: nathanhammond/ember-flows
attachments.text: ember-flows - Easily build complicated route traversal patterns in Ember.

text: however it never took off
AFAIK
There's even a fancy generator <https://nathanhammond.github.io/ember-flows-generator/>
wow
this is used for interactive tours over a page?
That was the idea - I mean, AFAIK it never left pre-alpha stage
Ember-flows has a readme and nothing else
Yeah, the generator app has actual code
Ok will play and contribute
you can find a lot of state machines in plain JS
doesn’t sound like it’ll meet all your needs but you could look at machty’s stacked routing too
JS state machine doesn't solve the routing issue. Ember flows presentation looks perfect

silly ember-data question … is ED meant to take care of the second leg of a bilateral CRUD operation? What I mean is in the case of a 1:M (aka, ownedBy & hasMany), if you update the _ownedBy_ attribute should the model which contains the _hasMany_ be updated for you?
and visa-versa
if not “out of the box” who’s responsibility should it fall to? App? Adaptor? Serialiser?
